I'd slightly prefer to avoid the above reinterpret_cast since I'm not sure converting a TensorMap<const T, ...>* to a TensorMap<T, ...>* will always be undefined-behavior free. Maybe someone more expert than me at interpreting the standard or Eigen can chime in :).

Since Tensor types are lightweight wrappers around reference-counted buffers, you can copy away the const-ness cheaply.

Tensor nonconst_in = in;
auto input = nonconst_in.flat_inner_dims<complex64, FFTRank + 1>();
